body_html:
The warning 'torch/csrc/cuda/nccl.cpp: No such file or directory' originates from the debugger when it tries to find the source code for the line where an error happened. It is not the error that's causing your program to terminate.

Do you see any other messages just before the SIGSEGV?

Looking at nccl.cpp at line 310, I think one of those arguments is not properly initialized. See:

pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/nccl.cpp

Lines 302 to 310 in e3839df

NCCL_CHECK(ncclReduce(
inputs[i].data_ptr(),
outputs[i].data_ptr(),
count,
data_type,
(ncclRedOp_t)op,
root,
comms_ref[i],
stream));

body:
The warning `'torch/csrc/cuda/nccl.cpp: No such file or directory'` originates from the debugger when it tries to find the source code for the line where an error happened. It is not the error that's causing your program to terminate.

Do you see any other messages just before the `SIGSEGV`?

Looking at `nccl.cpp` at line 310, I think one of those arguments is not properly initialized. See: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/e3839dfc35438ad6015e5e190ddef8d4f367440b/torch/csrc/cuda/nccl.cpp#L302-L310
